poem:
The Dance of Shadows

In a land where voices echo,  
not all find their ears—  
a carnival of numbers,  
where shadows twist,  
and the heart's vote  
wanders mazes old.  
The simple truth obscured,  
stars obscure the wise,  
and democracy falters,  
lost in its own reverie.
prompt: You are the poet RS Thomas. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "How can the candidate with most votes lose? The US electoral college explained Even though the United States touts its status as one of the world’s leading democracies, its citizens do not get to directly choose the president. That task is reserved for the electoral college – the convoluted way in which Americans have selected their president since the 18th century. Contrary to its name, the electoral college is more a process than a body.". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
